Type.name: Functional
Type.Description:
Provides functional operations on EPL containers, such as map, reduce, filter and slice.
Also provides generators which can be used as input to the functional operations.
eg: <tt>Functional.slice(Functional.map(Functional.filter(Functional.count(), (integer i)->i%2=0), (integer i)->i*2), 2, 8, 2);</tt>
Type.Summary: Provides functional operations on EPL containers, such as map, reduce, filter and slice.

Action.name: reduce
Action.Description:
Takes either a sequence or a dictionary and accumulates all of the values using an accumulator function, returning the final result. eg: Functional.reduce(numbers, (integer a, integer i)->a+i) Specifically, given:
  • sequence<TYPEA> container and action<TYPEB,TYPEA> returns TYPEB func will return the final TYPEB after calling func on each value, retaining TYPEB each time.
  • dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> container and action<TYPEB,KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> returns TYPEB func will return the final TYPEB after calling func on each key and value, retaining TYPEB each time.
Action.Summary: Takes either a sequence or a dictionary and accumulates all of the values using an accumulator function, returning the final result.

Returns.Description: The final result of the accumulator function.

Action.name: mul
Action.Description:
Action for multiplying together the values in a sequence or generator of integer, float or decimal using accumulate or reduce.
eg: <tt>integer product := Functional.reduce(numbers, Functional.mul);</tt>
Action.Summary: Action for multiplying together the values in a sequence or generator of integer, float or decimal using accumulate or reduce.

Action.name: count
Action.Description: Returns a generator producing sequential integers with the first one being 0.
Action.Summary: Returns a generator producing sequential integers with the first one being 0.

Action.name: range
Action.Description: Returns a range of integers from <tt>start</tt> (inclusive) to <tt>end</tt> (exclusive), incrementing <tt>stride</tt> each time.
Action.Summary: Returns a range of integers from <tt>start</tt> (inclusive) to <tt>end</tt> (exclusive), incrementing <tt>stride</tt> each time.

Action.name: sequenceOf
Action.Description: Returns a sequence containing the given item the given number of times.
Action.Summary: Returns a sequence containing the given item the given number of times.

Parameter.name: item
Parameter.Description: The element to put in the sequence.

Parameter.name: n
Parameter.Description: The number of times to repeat the element.

Action.name: sum
Action.Description:
Action for adding up a sequence or generator of integer, float or decimal using accumulate or reduce.
eg: <tt>integer sum := Functional.reduce(numbers, Functional.sum);</tt>
Action.Summary: Action for adding up a sequence or generator of integer, float or decimal using accumulate or reduce.

Action.name: concat
Action.Description: Action which concatenates strings using accumulate or reduce.
Action.Summary: Action which concatenates strings using accumulate or reduce.

Action.name: odd
Action.Description: A predicate which returns true if the argument is odd.
Action.Summary: A predicate which returns true if the argument is odd.

Action.name: filter
Action.Description:
Takes either a sequence, a dictionary or a generator and filters the contents using a boolean predicate func. eg: Functional.filter(numbers, (integer i)->i%2=0) Specifically, given:
  • sequence<TYPE> container and action<TYPE> returns boolean func will return sequence<TYPE> containing all the elements for which func returned true.
  • dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> container and action<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> returns boolean func will return dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPE> containing all the elements for which func returned true.
  • A generator returning TYPE and action<TYPE> returns boolean func will return a generator returning TYPE which only generates items from the original generator for which func returned true.
Action.Summary: Takes either a sequence, a dictionary or a generator and filters the contents using a boolean predicate func.

Returns.Description: The container filtered using the predicate function.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: A boolean predicate function or lambda.

Action.name: slice
Action.Description:
Takes either a sequence or a generator and returns a given sub-range as a finite sequence. If it is passed a generator, it will invoke the generator sufficient times immediately to satisfy the slice.
eg: <tt>Functional.slice(numbers, 5, 20, 2)</tt>
Action.Summary: Takes either a sequence or a generator and returns a given sub-range as a finite sequence. If it is passed a generator, it will invoke the generator sufficient times immediately to satisfy the slice.

Returns.Description: A <tt>sequence<TYPE></tt> containing the selected values from <tt>container</tt>

Parameter.name: end
Parameter.Description: The last item to return (-1 = all, only permitted for sequences).

Parameter.name: stride
Parameter.Description: The number of items to increment each time (1 = all).

Action.name: even
Action.Description: A predicate which returns true if the argument is even.
Action.Summary: A predicate which returns true if the argument is even.

Returns.Description: A generator which returns item over and over again.

Action.name: generateFrom
Action.Description:
Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value.
eg: <tt>Functional.generate(100, (integer i)->i+1)</tt>
Action.Summary: Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value.

Parameter.name: start
Parameter.Description: The value to pass to func to generate the first generation.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An <tt>action<TYPE> returns TYPE</tt> action or lambda which takes the previous value and returns the next value.

Action.name: accumulate
Action.Description: Returns a generator which accumulates over the underlying container, returning the result after accumulating each item. Similar to reduce, but returns a generator for each item in turn, rather than just the final total.
Action.Summary: Returns a generator which accumulates over the underlying container, returning the result after accumulating each item. Similar to reduce, but returns a generator for each item in turn, rather than just the final total.

Returns.Description: A generator which returns each accumulated item in turn.

Parameter.name: container
Parameter.Description: The sequence, dictionary or generator to accumulate.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An <tt>action<TYPEB,TYPEA> returns TYPEB</tt> action or lambda which accumulates each item in turn and returns the new total.

Action.name: map
Action.Description:
Takes either a sequence, a dictionary or a generator and maps the contents using a function. eg: Functional.map(numbers, (integer i)->i*2) Specifically, given:
  • sequence<TYPEA> container and action<TYPEA> returns TYPEB func will return sequence<TYPEB> containing the result of running func on all the elements in container.
  • dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPEA> container and action<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPEA> returns VALUETYPEB func will return dictionary<KEYTYPE,VALUETYPEB> containing the keys from container with the values being the result of running func.
  • A generator returning TYPEA and action<TYPEA> returns TYPEB func will return a generator returning TYPEB where each item is the corresponding item from the original generator after running func.
Action.Summary: Takes either a sequence, a dictionary or a generator and maps the contents using a function.

Returns.Description: The container with all the values run through func.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: A function or lambda from old value type to new value type.

Action.name: generate
Action.Description:
Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value. The initial value will be a default-initialized <tt>TYPE</tt> and the result of first generation will be the result of invoking <tt>func</tt> on that default-initialized value. To specify the initial value, use generateFrom.
eg: <tt>Functional.generate((integer i)->i+1)</tt>
Action.Summary: Create a generator from a function, which is passed the previous value and should return the next value. The initial value will be a default-initialized <tt>TYPE</tt> and the result of first generation will be the result of invoking <tt>func</tt> on that default-initialized value. To specify the initial value, use generateFrom.

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: An <tt>action<TYPE> returns TYPE</tt> action or lambda which takes the previous value and returns the next value.

Type.name: Generator
Type.Description: Represents a generator over a function. This class is used internally by Fuctional, but you can use any event with a generate method. Generate methods must take 0 arguments and can return the type of your choice (or any).
Type.Summary: Represents a generator over a function. This class is used internally by Fuctional, but you can use any event with a generate method. Generate methods must take 0 arguments and can return the type of your choice (or any).

Action.name: generate
Action.Description: Returns the next item from this generator.
Action.Summary: Returns the next item from this generator.
